tooltips.title: Microsoft Presidio
tooltips.body: Microsoft Presidio - Open-source PII detection engine with pattern recognizers. PatternRecognizer class with regex + checksums NLP integration via spaCy/Stanza Extensible with custom recognizers How anonymize uses it anonymize.today builds on Presidio with 256 pre-built entity types, 27 languages, and turnkey SaaS - no Python/Docker required. Source: Microsoft Presidio GitHub

tooltips.title: Argon2id
tooltips.body: Argon2id - Password-Based Key Derivation Function (PBKDF). Winner of Password Hashing Competition (PHC) 2015 RFC 9106 standardized Memory-hard against GPU/ASIC attacks Used by 1Password, Bitwarden In anonym.legal Derives encryption keys from user password. Server never sees the password or derived key - true zero-knowledge. Source: Marketing Analysis - Anonym Legal (lines 32-45)

tooltips.title: XChaCha20-Poly1305
tooltips.body: XChaCha20-Poly1305 - Authenticated encryption cipher suite. 256-bit encryption strength 192-bit nonce (safer than AES-GCM's 96-bit) Same cipher used by WireGuard VPN Implemented in libsodium Why XChaCha20 Extended nonce eliminates IV collision risk. No AES hardware required - constant-time on all platforms. Source: Marketing Analysis - Anonym Legal (lines 46-58)

tooltips.title: spaCy + Stanza
tooltips.body: spaCy + Stanza - Industrial NLP libraries for Named Entity Recognition. spaCy: 23+ language models, fast processing Stanza: Stanford NLP, 70+ languages Both integrate with Presidio In anonymize ecosystem NLP augments regex detection for context-aware entity recognition. Catches entities regex patterns might miss. Source: Microsoft Presidio | spaCy

tooltips.title: XLM-RoBERTa
tooltips.body: XLM-RoBERTa - Cross-lingual transformer model from Meta. Pre-trained on 100 languages Fine-tuned for 10-20 priority languages State-of-the-art multilingual NER Use case Powers multilingual entity detection in anonym.legal and cloak.business for government and banking documents. Source: XLM-RoBERTa (HuggingFace)

tooltips.title: Tesseract OCR
tooltips.body: Tesseract OCR - Open-source optical character recognition engine. Supports 100+ languages 48 languages used in blurgate.legal Combined with Presidio NLP for detection blurgate.legal OCR extracts text from images/PDFs, then Presidio detects PII. Pixel-perfect redaction with 6 color options. Source: Marketing Analysis - Brand Portals (lines 45-52)

tooltips.title: BIP39
tooltips.body: BIP39 - Bitcoin Improvement Proposal 39 for mnemonic recovery. 24-word seed phrase Deterministic key derivation No server-side password reset Used by all crypto wallets In anonym.legal/plus Users can recover their encryption key using 24 words. Even if the server is compromised, data remains encrypted. Source: Marketing Analysis - Anonym Legal (lines 59-72)

tooltips.title: Audit Trail: Perfect vs Varies
tooltips.body: Audit Trail: Perfect vs Varies Deterministic regex produces identical output for identical input - essential for compliance audits. Same document processed today = same result in 5 years Third parties can independently verify results No "confidence score" ambiguity AI limitation AI/ML models produce confidence scores (0.0-1.0) that vary between runs. Results may differ across model versions. Source: Nature Scientific Reports

tooltips.title: GDPR Article 35: Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA)
tooltips.body: GDPR Article 35: Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) Required for high-risk processing involving personal data. Deterministic: Native compliance - results are predictable and documented AI/ML: Requires additional documentation explaining how the model works Regulatory advantage DPOs prefer deterministic systems because they can explain exactly why data was classified as PII. Source: GDPR Article 35

tooltips.title: Model Drift
tooltips.body: Model Drift - AI accuracy degrades over time without retraining. Language patterns evolve New PII formats emerge Training data becomes stale Model updates change behavior anonymize advantage Deterministic regex has zero drift . Patterns are explicit and static - no retraining cycles, no unexpected behavior changes. Source: Nature Scientific Reports

tooltips.title: Cost: Lower vs GPU
tooltips.body: Cost: Lower vs GPU Regex: Minimal CPU, runs on any server AI/ML: GPU acceleration required, higher compute costs TCO impact AI inference costs $0.01-0.10+ per 1K tokens. Regex pattern matching is essentially free after initial development. Source: Nature Scientific Reports

tooltips.title: Speed: Fast vs Slower
tooltips.body: Speed: Fast vs Slower Regex: Milliseconds for pattern matching AI/ML: Model loading + inference latency Real-world impact Regex processes 10,000+ documents/minute. AI models may require batching and async processing for similar throughput. Source: Nature Scientific Reports

tooltips.title: Explainability: 100% vs Black Box
tooltips.body: Explainability: 100% vs Black Box Regex: You can inspect exactly why a match occurred AI/ML: Neural network decisions are opaque Compliance requirement Regulators and auditors want to understand HOW decisions are made. "The AI said so" is not an acceptable audit response. Source: Nature Scientific Reports

tooltips.title: Legal Evidence: Court-OK vs Risk
tooltips.body: Legal Evidence: Court-OK vs Risk Deterministic: Results are court-admissible as reproducible evidence Probabilistic: Confidence scores may be challenged in legal proceedings Use case Legal e-discovery, FOIA requests, and compliance investigations require reproducible, verifiable redaction.

tooltips.title: Winner of the Password Hashing Competition (PHC).
tooltips.body: Winner of the Password Hashing Competition (PHC). Argon2id is the hybrid version combining Argon2i (side-channel resistance) and Argon2d (GPU resistance): RFC 9106 standardized Resistant to GPU/ASIC attacks Memory-hard function prevents parallel cracking Used by 1Password, Bitwarden, Signal vs PBKDF2/bcrypt Unlike older algorithms, Argon2id requires significant memory, making brute-force attacks economically infeasible. Visit: anonym.legal Source: anonym.legal

tooltips.title: 19 MiB minimum memory per hash operation.
tooltips.body: 19 MiB minimum memory per hash operation. Memory-hard design makes GPU/ASIC attacks expensive: OWASP 2024 recommended minimum Prevents dictionary attacks at scale Each attempt requires dedicated RAM Attacker cost: ~$50K+ for 1M/sec throughput Why it matters Password cracking farms rely on parallel GPU processing. Memory requirements force sequential, expensive attacks. Source: anonym.legal

tooltips.title: 2 iterations minimum per OWASP guidelines.
tooltips.body: 2 iterations minimum per OWASP guidelines. Balances security with user experience: OWASP 2024 recommendation for interactive logins Sub-second derivation on modern devices Configurable up to 10+ for high-security use cases Combined with memory makes attacks impractical Customization Enterprise deployments can increase iterations for vault/admin access while keeping user-facing auth responsive. Source: anonym.legal

tooltips.title: Same cipher used by WireGuard VPN.
tooltips.body: Same cipher used by WireGuard VPN. XChaCha20-Poly1305 provides authenticated encryption: 256-bit key: Modern symmetric encryption standard 192-bit nonce: Extended nonce prevents reuse issues Poly1305 MAC: Tamper detection built-in AEAD (Authenticated Encryption with Associated Data) vs AES-GCM XChaCha20 is simpler, constant-time by design, and doesn't require hardware acceleration for performance. Source: anonym.legal

tooltips.title: 256-bit symmetric key - the modern security standard.
tooltips.body: 256-bit symmetric key - the modern security standard. 2^256 possible keys (more than atoms in universe) NIST approved for TOP SECRET classification Quantum-resistant at current understanding Industry standard for financial, healthcare, government Brute force estimate At 1 trillion keys/second, cracking would take ~10^60 years - longer than the universe has existed. Spain's constitution guarantees regional language rights: Catalan: Catalonia, Balearic Islands (7.5M speakers) Valencian: Valencia region (legally distinct from Catalan) Basque: Basque Country (700K speakers, language isolate) Galician: Galicia (2.4M speakers) Aranese: Val d'Aran (5K speakers, Occitan variant) Government mandate All 17 autonomous communities provide services in regional languages. PII patterns differ per region (DNI vs NIE formats). Source: Multilingual Government Analysis | Visit: anonymize.today

tooltips.title: 4 national languages with equal legal status.
tooltips.body: 4 national languages with equal legal status. Swiss federal system requires multilingual support: German: 63% of population (various dialects) French: 23% of population Italian: 8% of population (Ticino) Romansh: 0.5% (Graubunden, 5 dialects) PII complexity Swiss AHV numbers, cantonal formats, and multilingual addresses require specialized patterns. 26 cantons with varying requirements. Source: Multilingual Government Analysis | Visit: anonymize.today

tooltips.title: 3 official languages across 3 regions.
tooltips.body: 3 official languages across 3 regions. Belgium's complex linguistic landscape: Dutch (Flemish): Flanders (60% of population) French: Wallonia + Brussels (40%) German: East Belgium (1%, ~77K speakers) Brussels: Officially bilingual (Dutch/French) Federal requirements Federal government is trilingual. All official documents available in 3 languages. National ID (eID) patterns uniform but names/addresses vary. Source: Multilingual Government Analysis | Visit: anonymize.today

tooltips.title: 3 official languages + widespread English usage.
tooltips.body: 3 official languages + widespread English usage. Luxembourg as EU financial center: Luxembourgish: National language (daily use) French: Administrative/legal language German: Secondary administrative language English: Financial sector standard Banking sector impact Major EU banking hub with 130+ banks. Financial documents in multiple languages. Tax (fiche) and ID patterns unique to Luxembourg. Source: Multilingual Government Analysis | Visit: anonymize.today

rows: Only platform combining ZK architecture with PII anonymization
24 EU + regional dialects with audit-proof detection

tooltips.title: Same input = Same output, every time.
tooltips.body: Same input = Same output, every time. AI/ML systems produce confidence scores (0.0-1.0) that vary between runs. The same document processed twice may yield different results. Deterministic regex patterns are static and explicit: 100% reproducible for audit trails Court-admissible as legal evidence Zero model drift over time No retraining required Why it matters Regulated industries (banking, government, healthcare) require reproducible results for compliance audits. Source: Fortune Business Insights

tooltips.title: 48 languages with full regional dialect support.
tooltips.body: 48 languages with full regional dialect support. Not just major languages - includes regional variants that competitors miss: Spanish: Castilian, Catalan, Valencian, Basque, Galician German: Standard, Swiss German, Austrian French: Standard, Belgian, Swiss, Canadian Dutch: Standard, Flemish (Belgian) Competitor gap Azure has 96-97 languages but lacks regional variant patterns. AWS Comprehend supports only English + Spanish. Source: Multilingual Government Analysis

tooltips.title: 290+ entity types across 75+ countries.

BigID focuses on data discovery, not PII patterns. Visit: cloak.business Source: Fortune Business Insights

tooltips.title: Regex vs AI/ML: Fundamental difference.
tooltips.body: Regex vs AI/ML: Fundamental difference. Azure AI: ML-based NER with confidence scores (0.0-1.0) BigID: AI-powered data intelligence platform anonymize: Deterministic regex pattern matching Key advantage Regex patterns produce identical results every time. AI models are probabilistic - results vary between runs and model versions. Source: Fortune Business Insights

tooltips.title: Transparent vs Black-box processing.
tooltips.body: Transparent vs Black-box processing. For regulated industries, audit trails must be: Reproducible: Same input = same output Verifiable: Third parties can validate Time-stable: Results don't change AI limitation AI systems are black boxes - you can't explain why a specific confidence score was produced. Regex patterns are explicit and auditable. Source: Fortune Business Insights

tooltips.title: AI models degrade without retraining.
tooltips.body: AI models degrade without retraining. Language patterns evolve over time New PII formats emerge Training data becomes stale Model updates change behavior anonymize advantage Deterministic regex has zero drift - patterns are explicit and static. No retraining cycles, no unexpected behavior changes. Source: Fortune Business Insights

tooltips.title: EU data stays in the EU.
tooltips.body: EU data stays in the EU. US Cloud Act implications: US-based providers (Azure, AWS, BigID) subject to US law US government can compel data disclosure EU data protection may be compromised anonymize solution German hosting (Hetzner, ISO 27001 certified). No US Cloud Act exposure. Full GDPR compliance with EU-only processing. Source: anonymize.today

tooltips.title: Regional variants matter for compliance.
tooltips.body: Regional variants matter for compliance. They miss regional patterns that government agencies require. Source: Multilingual Government Analysis
